reviews.review_msg:
I got nothing to say 
She doesn't care abt ur grade 
Don't take this class if it's not mandatory 
Trust me

I have loved media arts my entire life & Laura almost made me hate it. Her lectures are extremely hard to understand & her exams are VERY unfair. Other than the grace period on each assignment, she did not seem to make any effort in caring for her students, especially during a pandemic. Lots of unnecessary reading too.
The class itself was okay, but god this teacher...at least my TA was nice

The TA I had and the only creative video project were the only saving graces of this class, everything else was overbearing with papers to write. Lots of miscommunication related to tests and would go onto tangents; made the class watch the same 5 minutes of an old movie to "analyze" it for an entire 2 hour class. Tested us on useless information.

This class was a mandatory class for my CA program. The prof is very unorganized, unclear, and rambles on during lectures on concepts that aren't relevant and spends a few minutes talking about what will actually be tested on. The syllabus is inaccurate in getting information about examinations. Don't take this course unless it's mandatory.

Laura Marks is unorganized and chaotic. We never get through a lecture and have to continue it into the next week. She never prepares you properly for the tests. This course is mandatory for all CA students but is of no benefit unless you are a film major. This course was not it!!!!

The lectures are a mess, the test questions are horribly worded, the course is disorganized because of her desire to stray from the usage of Canvas- which makes everything hard to track. Unless this course is mandatory for you, don't take it.

Your grade does not reflect your effort, totally speechless. Course material is easy to understand but quizzes and final are all out of syllabus, use your common sense to answer. Dont recommend this course if you are not a SCA student. Good luck people:)

Laura has absolutely no respect for her students. She seemed annoyed when questions were asked, she did not respond to important emails in a timely manner, and did not give warnings for flashing and very graphic material. She almost made me hate film.

Her pros: super nice, easy class, extremely lenient late policy, easy tests. Her cons: lots of unnecessary readings, long papers, terribly worded test questions. The final's first question was, did you read the instructions? The answers were true or false. More difficult questions will lower your grade because they are that badly worded.

Professor Laura Marks teaches the course in a way where she does not care about students, especially during the pandemic. Whenever a question is asked in class, her tone would sound annoyed as if you hurt her in a way. Instructions are vague and the final exam outline was a final review of course material.

Professor Marks lacks respect for her students. There were no warnings for flashing or very graphic material, and she did not give adequate time for her tests or exams. She yelled at a student when they asked for a more detailed exam outline when she was being very vague. She does allow a "grace period" for essays, but overall disappointing.

In my opinion, I feel that Professor Marks does not effectively teach this course. Sometimes you get the feeling she is upset at you for asking questions and it kind of hurts. This course was taken online during COVID-19, however I feel this shouldn't have necessarily been a great factor or difference makers as most materials were online video.

Good lord, this woman is something else. She doesnt put warnings before triggering movies, nearly gave a student a seizure from a film, and refuses to give a real exam outline for the final exam. I thought this class would be enjoyable but Im sorry, Laura, it was reseaaally not it.

Laura is inspiring but also very confusing with her instructions. Her lectures are pointless to attend unless you're doing review simply because she gets off topic easily. Rely on your TAs and tutorials for any actual information.
